title: The Awards Trophy Swap
setting: Redline Advertising, lobby display case, Monday 9 AM
premise: The firm's prestigious Clio Award trophy has been replaced with a cheap plastic replica. The real trophy was last verified Friday at 5 PM when the cleaner polished the case.

suspects.name: Vera Sinclair
suspects.motive: Believes she deserved credit for the winning campaign, not the team lead
suspects.alibi: I left Friday at 4 PM for a dentist appointment. I spent the whole weekend at my beach house in Montauk. I have gas station receipts from the drive out.

suspects.name: Elliot Graham
suspects.motive: Wanted to prank the firm before transferring to the Chicago office
suspects.alibi: I was in the office until 6 PM Friday wrapping up account handoffs. Over the weekend I packed my apartment for the move. My roommate helped me Saturday and Sunday.

suspects.name: June Nakamura
suspects.motive: She holds the only spare key to the display case and resents being underpaid
suspects.alibi: I closed up reception at 5:30 PM Friday and went to a concert downtown. Saturday and Sunday I visited my parents in New Jersey. I wasn't near the office.

suspects.name: Dominic Reese
suspects.motive: Has a side business selling memorabilia and collectibles online
suspects.alibi: I did my Friday evening rounds at 7 PM and locked up by 8 PM. I don't work weekends. I was home watching the game Saturday with my neighbors.

clues.title: Display Case Lock
clues.content: The display case lock shows no signs of being picked or forced. It was opened with a key. Only two keys exist: one in the managing director's safe, and June's spare at her reception desk.

clues.title: Weekend Building Access
clues.content: The building's weekend sign-in log shows Elliot entered Saturday at 3:15 PM, stating he needed to 'pick up files.' He was the only weekend visitor.

clues.title: Reception Desk Drawer
clues.content: The spare display case key is kept in June's locked desk drawer. Security footage from Friday at 5:55 PM shows Elliot lingering at the reception desk after June had already left.
